verses.plain: Remember, O LORD, what is come upon us: consider, and behold our reproach.

tokens.t: Remember, O
, what is come upon us: consider, and behold our reproach.

verses.plain: Our inheritance is turned to strangers, our houses to aliens.

tokens.t: Our inheritance is turned to strangers, our houses to aliens.

verses.plain: We are orphans and fatherless, our mothers are as widows.

tokens.t: We are orphans and fatherless, our mothers
as widows.

verses.plain: We have drunken our water for money; our wood is sold unto us.

tokens.t: We have drunken our water for money; our wood is sold unto us.

verses.plain: Our necks are under persecution: we labour, and have no rest.

tokens.t: Our necks
under persecution: we labour,
have no rest.

verses.plain: We have given the hand to the Egyptians, and to the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.

tokens.t: We have given the hand
the Egyptians,
the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.

verses.plain: Our fathers have sinned, and are not; and we have borne their iniquities.

tokens.t: Our fathers have sinned,
not; and we have borne their iniquities.

verses.plain: Servants have ruled over us: there is none that doth deliver us out of their hand.

tokens.t: Servants have ruled over us:
none that doth deliver
out of their hand.

verses.plain: We gat our bread with the peril of our lives because of the sword of the wilderness.

tokens.t: We gat our bread with
our lives because of the sword of the wilderness.

verses.plain: Our skin was black like an oven because of the terrible famine.

tokens.t: Our skin was black like an oven because of the terrible famine.

verses.plain: They ravished the women in Zion, and the maids in the cities of Judah.

tokens.t: They ravished the women in Zion,
the maids in the cities of Judah.

verses.plain: Princes are hanged up by their hand: the faces of elders were not honoured.

tokens.t: Princes are hanged up by their hand: the faces of elders were not honoured.

verses.plain: They took the young men to grind, and the children fell under the wood.

tokens.t: They took the young men to grind, and the children fell under the wood.

verses.plain: The elders have ceased from the gate, the young men from their musick.

tokens.t: The elders have ceased from the gate, the young men from their musick.

verses.plain: The joy of our heart is ceased; our dance is turned into mourning.

tokens.t: The joy of our heart is ceased; our dance is turned into mourning.

verses.plain: The crown is fallen from our head: woe unto us, that we have sinned!

tokens.t: The crown is fallen
our head: woe unto us, that we have sinned!

verses.plain: For this our heart is faint; for these things our eyes are dim.

tokens.t: For this our heart is faint; for these
our eyes are dim.

verses.plain: Because of the mountain of Zion, which is desolate, the foxes walk upon it.

tokens.t: Because of the mountain of Zion, which is desolate, the foxes walk upon it.

verses.plain: Thou, O LORD, remainest for ever; thy throne from generation to generation.

tokens.t: Thou, O
, remainest for ever; thy throne from generation to generation.

verses.plain: Wherefore dost thou forget us for ever, and forsake us so long time?

tokens.t: Wherefore dost thou forget us for ever,
forsake us so long time?

verses.plain: Turn thou us unto thee, O LORD, and we shall be turned; renew our days as of old.

tokens.t: Turn thou us unto thee, O
, and we shall be turned; renew our days as of old.

verses.plain: But thou hast utterly rejected us; thou art very wroth against us.

tokens.t: But thou hast utterly rejected us; thou art very wroth against us.

footnotes.text: Our…: Heb. On our necks are we persecuted
The…: Heb. The crown of our head is fallen
so…: Heb. for length of days?
But…: or, For wilt thou utterly reject us?
